@duffy_ma I do wonder how they deal with all that left-behind sand on the boulevards at the end of winter; I assume city workers clean up?
@duffy_ma I spent a winter in Sudbury, Ontario and they used a lot of sand. I remember seeing the piles of built-up sand in the spring!

Was thinking of submitting to the American Journal of Epidemiology, but they charge authors $95 per page? Ouch.
Related question: what are the norms about how often one can submit different manuscripts to the same journal? Do journals have policies?
@leah_boustan Will add Demography to my list to consider - thanks!
@GaetanBurgio Hadn't even thought of Plos One! Hmm.
@GaetanBurgio Had initially thought of an epidem journal but specific ways they wanted things reported seemed not good fit. Might rethink.
@leah_boustan Would be an option, though I've already got a paper coming out with them this year - not sure on norms about that?
@anthroetc Suggestions of appropriate journals (pref. online with good open access policies) welcome!
@anthroetc At <5,000 words, apparently too short for the hist./hist geog. journals, but has lots of tables/figures (and stats tests).
Struggling to find appropriate journal fit for a fairly interdiscip. paper on historical geography of diphtheria mortality in Hamilton, Ont.
